sect1.title: Configure Log-Sources
sect1.para: Log files that are to monitored are specified using the Log File Selection Dialog(see )

sect1.title: Global Configuration Parameters
sect1.para: Global configuration parameters are configured by opening the global configuration panel. Press the Open Configuration Dialog Box button for this purpose ().
The configuration parameters and their meaning are:

listitem.para: Set the title of the main &logtracker; application window. This is especially useful, when multiple &logtracker; instances are running.
Set the display format of time stamps throughout the application. The Java SimpleDateFormat notation is used.
Is used as the maximum value for the time range for new scatter plots (see ).

sect1.title: Configuration Files
sect1.para: &logtracker; configurations can be stored in configuration files. It supports two basic forms:

listitem.para:
Complete configuration files contain information about all configurable parameters of a running &logtracker; instance.
In the present version, the layout of the &logtracker;'s main window and its panels is not part of the configuration.
Log Parser configuration files contain only log parser configuration data.

sect1.para:
Both types store their information in XML format
&logtracker; versions prior to 2.0 have used a binary format for the configuration files. The actual version is still able to read and understand those binary files, but it can only store configuration in the new XML-based format. Migration old config-files is easy: just open and store them with &logtracker;. as an "*.ltc"-file (ltc = LogTracker Configuration). A complete configuration file is created, when a user presses the Save LogTracker Configuration button at the top of the main application window (see ). A Log Parser configuration file is created when a user presses the Save to file-button in the parser configuration dialog box (see ). Only the configurations of the parsers that are selected in the parser configuration table are stored into the file. Multiple parsers can be selected by Shift-Clicking multiple lines.

The according Load Configuration Files and Load from File buttons have a corresponding effect. The first, loads a full configuration. The second loads only parser configurations. When loading, the existing application configuration is not overwritten. The new configuration is rather added as additional information: New log parser configurations are added to the existing ones. Additional log sources are added to new instances of Log file selection dialogs.
